org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.gameHandling

Class ClientGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fhnw.aigs.swingClient.gameHandling.ClientGame

  • public abstract class ClientGame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the equivalent of "Game" on the client side. However it is merely a container class that contains all important facts of a game:
    The game name, a reference to the player, the gameMode and a reference to the current "BaseGameWindow". The latter allows the game to manipulate the GUI directly when using the standard AIGS BaseClient.
    v1.0 Initial release
    v1.1 Functional changes, additional properties
    Version:
    v1.1 (Raphael Stoeckli, 22.10.2014)
    Author:
    Matthias St√∂ckli (v1.0)

    • Field Detail

      • gameName

        protected java.lang.String gameName
        The name of the game, e.g. "TicTacToe". This must be the same name as the package name!

      • partyName

        protected java.lang.String partyName
        The name of the Party

      • joinType

        protected org.fhnw.aigs.commons.JoinType joinType
        The type of starting the game respectively to join in a existing game

      • player

        protected org.fhnw.aigs.commons.Player player
        A reference to the player, this will usually be set by the ClientMessageBroker in the course of the identification process. Once the client was identified, the server sends back the definite player name which will be used to identify the player.

      • gameMode

        protected org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode gameMode
        The game mode helps controlling the game flow. if the game mode "SinglePlayer" is selected, it is not possible to use the method "startGameWith" on the client side.

      • gameWindow

        protected BaseGameWindow gameWindow
        The BaseGameWindow holds a reference to the gameWindow. This class is used in the standard JavaFX based AIGS BaseClient for showing the GUI. It can be accessed whenever the GUI changes on a large scale, for example when an overlay (loading screen, end game screen etc.) should be faded in or out.

      • noInteractionAllowed

        protected boolean noInteractionAllowed
        Indicates whether the game is still running or not

      • versionString

        protected java.lang.String versionString
        Indicates a (optional) version number of the game. Use this for better version control of games on the server

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientGame

        public ClientGame(java.lang.String gameName,
                  org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode mode)
        Creates a new instance of a ClientGame with the specified name and a gameMode. This constructor will set up the Shutdown hook which takes care of the house keeping like sending RoceCloseMessages upon termination.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name, e.g. TicTacToe
        mode - The game mode, e.g. SinglePlayer

      • ClientGame

        public ClientGame(java.lang.String gameName,
                  java.lang.String version,
                  org.fhnw.aigs.commons.GameMode mode)
        Creates a new instance of a ClientGame with the specified name, version and gameMode. This constructor will set up the Shutdown hook which takes care of the house keeping like sending RoceCloseMessages upon termination.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name, e.g. TicTacToe
        mode - The game mode, e.g. SinglePlayer
        version - The version of the game

      • ClientGame

        public ClientGame(java.lang.String gameName)
        Creates a new instance of a ClientGame with the specified name. This constructor does not specify a game mode. It can be used when there is no need for a game mode. The GameMode will then be set to SinglePlayer which will have no effect on the game as long as not specifically implemente in the game logic.
        Parameters:
        gameName - The game's name, e.g. "TicTacToe"

      • processGameLogic

        public abstract void processGameLogic(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message)
        This method is the core of every game on the client side. Due to the abstract nature, it must be implemented by every ClientGame. The method is responsible for the the processing of incoming messages. It is intended to work in a very similar way to the processGameLogic method of the server side.
        ProcessGameLogic() will be called as soon as a non system message (e.g. ClientShutdownMessage or similar) arrives. The ClientMessageBroker will forward the class to this method. In this method it will then be interpreted and the results will change whatever is needed, e.g. the GUI.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be processed.

      • onGameReady

        public abstract void onGameReady()
        This abstract method will be called once a connection to the server$ has successfully been established. This method is the last possibility for the player to ask for any special input or similar, before a game starts. Usually, the onGameReady() method ends with a call of startGame() which will trigger a JoinMessage. The server will then start a new game or let the player join an existing game.

      • sendMessageToServer

        public void sendMessageToServer(org.fhnw.aigs.commons.communication.Message message)
        Sends a message to the server. Please note: This method is just a shorthand. It just calls the ClientMessageBroker's sendMessage method which will call the method's sendMessage method. The same effect could be achieved by statically loading ClientMessageBroker.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Initializes the game on the server side by sending a JoinMessage. The Server will decide whether to create or join a game depending on the defined join type. The JoinMessage will contain the name of the game, the join type and the game mode.
        This method will be called in onGameReady()

      • startNamedParty

        public void startNamedParty(java.lang.String partyName)
        This method is similar to the "startGame()" method. Initializes the game on the server side by sending a JoinMessage. The JoinMessage will contain the name of the game and the game mode. Additionally a player can indicate a Game.partyName. In this case the server will match all people who indicated the same partyName
        Parameters:
        partyName - The name of the party, e.g. "TicTacPascal"

      • setUpLogging

        private static void setUpLogging()
        This method is responsible for the logging by setting a FileHandler. Usually the log files will be saved to the folder "logs", under the name "aigs.log" If this is not possible, a new log file will be created.
